title: American_Top_40_1985_June_22nd
description:
"We're on our way to the number one song in the USA."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

A listener asks, "What is the largest group of instrument playing musicians ever to hit the top 40?" Casey says it was five rock 'n' rollers accompanied by 125 members of a marching band.

The act Casey calls "the biggest selling American group in history" has a hit in this countdown.

Casey visits the American Top 40 Hall of Fame to honor the most successful female singer in the history of the charts, Diana Ross.

Casey answers this question; "Has any group ever hit the pop chart with a song whose title was the name of the group?" Casey reports it has happened five times, tells about each time, and then plays the latest song by one of those groups because they have a hit in this countdown.

A listener wants to know (and Casey tells us) whatever happened to the band known as "The Band."

Casey answers the question, "What was the fastest rising song by a woman?" Casey says two songs tie; one about a girl who loses her boyfriend at her own party, and the other about a guy who jumps off a bridge, before playing a portion of each.
